required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of a New Formulation of Insulin Glargine With Lantus in Patients With Type 2 Diabetes on Non-insulin Antidiabetic Therapy
clinical_study.official_title: 6-Month, Multicenter, Randomized, Open-label, Parallel-group Study Comparing the Efficacy and Safety of a New Formulation of Insulin Glargine and Lantus® in Insulin-Naïve Patients With Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus Not Adequately Controlled With Non-Insulin Antihyperglycemic Drugs With a 6-month Safety Extension Period

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

brief_summary.textblock:
Primary Objective:
To compare the efficacy of a new formulation of insulin glargine and Lantus in terms of change of HbA1c from baseline to endpoint (scheduled at month 6, week 26) in patients with type 2 diabetes mellitus.
Secondary Objectives:
To compare a new formulation of insulin glargine and Lantus in terms of:
- occurrence of nocturnal hypoglycemia
- change in pre-injection plasma glucose,
- change in variability of pre-injection plasma glucose

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Change in HbA1c from baseline to endpoint

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence (%) of patients with at least one nocturnal hypoglycemia, indicated as severe and/or confirmed by plasma glucose ≤ 70 mg/dL(3.9 mmol/L) occurred from week9 to endpoint
Change in pre-injection plasma glucose from baseline to endpoint
Change in variability of pre-injection plasma glucose (coefficient of variation over 7 days) from baseline to endpoint
Proportion (%) of patients with HbA1c <7 % at endpoint
Proportion (%) of patients with FPG <100 mg/dL
Change in fasting plasma glucose (FPG) from baseline to endpoint
Change in 8-point SMPG profiles per time-point from baseline to endpoint
Change of mean 24h plasma glucose (based on 8-point SMPG profiles)
Change in variability in mean 24h plasma glucose (based on 8-point SMPG profiles)
Change in daily basal insulin dose from baseline to endpoint
Change from baseline in treatment satisfaction score using the Diabetes Treatment Satisfaction Questionnaire (DTSQs)
Number of Patients with various types of Hypoglycemia Events

arm_group.description: once daily on top of non-insulin antihyperglycemic drugs
once daily on top of non-insulin antihyperglycemic drugs

intervention.description: Pharmaceutical form: solution Route of administration: subcutaneous
Pharmaceutical form: solution Route of administration: subcutaneous
